intro: Ocimum fimbriatum var. fimbriatum, commonly known as the purple basil, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its aromatic, purple-hued leaves and small, white or light purple flowers. The plant belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs such as mint and lavender. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often cultivated for its culinary and medicinal uses. Its leaves contain essential oils that contribute to its distinct fragrance and various therapeutic properties.
